# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Data

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines")

function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int = 10)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""
    for word in split(text)
        # Check if we need to start a new line
        if length(current_line) + length(word) > text_width
            # If so, add the current line and start a new one
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            # Otherwise, just append to the current line
            current_line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    # Don't forget to add the last line
    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

wrap_string("This function will wrap words into lines") == "This function will\nwrap words into lines"
